intro: Epipactis maricae, commonly known as the Maricae helleborine, is a rare orchid species native to specific regions of Europe. It is a terrestrial herb with a short, underground rhizome and a single, erect stem. The plant produces a single leaf and a spike of flowers, which are typically greenish-yellow with purple spots. Its flowers are characterized by a hooded lip and are pollinated by specific insect species. Epipactis maricae is listed as endangered due to habitat loss and limited distribution.
